content:
Is there any preferred way as to how to cite MIL? I'm going with the BibLaTeX @online record as:

Jeremy Avigad and Patrick Massot. Mathematics in Lean. URL: leanprover-community.github.io/mathematics_in_lean/index.html

but if there's a better way I can of course change it. @Patrick Massot @Jeremy Avigad
That’s a very good question, but I don’t have any answer. Maybe Jeremy will have one since the question was probably asked about TPIL before.

I don't have a better answer. I tend to use something like this:

@misc{avigad:massot:online,
  author = {Jeremy Avigad and Patrick Massot},
  title = {Mathematics in Lean},
  howpublished = {\url{https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathematics_in_lean/}}
}

BibLatex is new to me, but @online sounds appropriate.

Thanks for citing it!
Luigi Massacci has marked this topic as resolved.
